text: The North Riding of Yorkshire is one of the three historic subdivisions (ridings) of the English county of Yorkshire, alongside the East and West ridings. They have never been abolished along with the other historic counties and they are three of the historic counties of England, which do not change and neither do their boundaries. These can be found in the UK new passport inside the back cover as a hologram. ==Other websites== *Map of the North Riding of Yorkshire on Wikishire *Information on the North Riding of Yorkshire on I'm From Yorkshire Category:Yorkshire
title: North Riding of Yorkshire
